entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (5)20151226
I did the two missions in the Imperial Capital. The first one was
not very hard but the second one, the escape, was very hard. I
think I will do it a few more times to grind. I started the first
one at level 20, with a few characters at 21, and the two missions
were ranked 22 and then 23. The combat is still awesome in this
game. I think my favorite character is Seven.

Total time: 12:27

  • Final Fantasy Type-0 HD
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 4: A New Hope, directed by George Lucas (1977)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 4: A New Hope, directed by George Lucas (1977)20151226
This movie is so good. There are definitely inconsistencies with
the rest of the universe but on the other hand there's so many
ideas that are alluded to in Obi-Wan's little speech at the
beginning. I like how spunky Leia is.  I think it is weird that
Obi-Wan immediately has Luke start training when he's lived so
close to him this whole time and never did anything about it.
  • Movies
  • 1977

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 3: Revenge of the Sith, directed by George Lucas (2005)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 3: Revenge of the Sith, directed by George Lucas (2005)20151225
This is a very sad movie and it is very interesting to finally see
Anakin's descent to the dark side. I think this is my favorite one
and it shows lots of twisted things about the Emperor and his
attitude. I think it is a little unexplained why Anakin so quickly
becomes gun-ho after his "What have I done?" moment and I think it
is also a little bit unexplained why he wants to rule the galaxy
himself but then changes his mind after being given his robot body
(he does not seem to give any indication of rebellion later in the
series, other than THE SCENE.)

It is a bit sad that Padme is damseled out of the movie by her
pregnancy. It's interesting because they continue to disregard her
during action scenes. Whereas before it was endearing because she
could fend for herself, now she's unconscious and still no one
worries about her.

What a raw deal Luke gets... his sister gets to be a princess and
he gets to be a poor farmer. It's not even like Kenobi was training
him the whole time.

The scene where all the Jedi are killed is totally epic.

I don't understand what "Vader" means and why Sidious just suddenly
came up with that name.

When Anakin says, "I'm twice as powerful as when we last fought",
it reminded me of Dragon Ball where people always say stuff like
that.
  • Movies
  • 2005

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (3)20151224
I did another mission and I was told that the next mission would
be a level 22 mission, so I need to do some grinding before I am
ready to take it on. This is pretty annoying because I don't like
the waterway mission. I can't tell what actions are giving my
characters experience. Do I get it just for fighting? Is there any
more for finishing the level? Is there a disadvantage for dying?
The game is too opaque in this department.

Total time: 7:48
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy Type-0 HD
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (2)20151223
I played for a long time today and did the first three missions
(surprisingly little for how long I played, although I played each
mission multiple times to even out my levels.)

This game definitely looks like a PSP game and not at all like a
PS4 game. The models are all pretty bad, the animation is bad, and
I'm amazed that the loading times are so bad.

The battles are really fun, although it is a little bit loose and
unsophisticated and the camera is way too sensitive and basically
useless.

The game feels like it wants you to grind a lot, but on the other
hand it feels very hard to actually grind because it costs so many
hours to fight in the field, but the missions are a bit too long
and painful to grind during. I wish there were more difficulty
options between Officer and Agito so I could gradually ramp
up. Even though I played the same missions many times, it was
always fun because of the combat.

The timer and all the different events makes me feel like I am
missing everything every day of the game time, which is very
annoying.

The story is very fun and bizarre. I like the way that l'Cie in
this game are background superheroes, unlike the other FF13 games
where you are the l'Cie.

I think the most surprising thing about this game is that it isn't
really like an RPG at all. The combat is totally action-based, you
don't seem to gain that much from leveling up, and there's never
any weapons or armor to buy. It feels more like a Final Fantasy
team wanted to make a Monster Hunter-like game and followed the
pattern that they knew and ended up with this.

I will definitely keep playing, but I am very annoyed at not being
able to keep my team balanced or spend the huge amounts of gil
that I have available. We'll see how I feel after another session.

Total time: 5:56
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy Type-0 HD
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 2: Attack of the Clones, directed by George Lucas (2002)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 2: Attack of the Clones, directed by George Lucas (2002)20151223
This movie is way better than Phantom Menace.

I vastly prefer the droids as the comic relief characters than
Jar-Jar. They are much more about "dad jokes" whereas Jar-Jar is
more like fart and poop jokes.

Portman looks so good in this movie. Her dresses are so cool and
they are all so different and interesting. The cute montage of
Anakin and Amidala worked very well. It is odd that no one comments
on them kissing multiple times during the Jedi fight in the arena.

I think my favorite part of the movie is how gradually, slowly, and
believable things are turning bad for the republic and Anakin.

It is very impactful to see the clones and the star destroyers
loaded up and off for the first time. The whole plan of Palpatine
and Dooku is very interesting. I feel like I need to study the
Wookipedia to know what happened during the Clone Wars TV show.
  • Movies
  • 2002

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 1: The Phantom Menace, directed by George Lucas (1999) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 1: The Phantom Menace, directed by George Lucas (1999) (2)20151222
This movie is (in some ways) not as bad as I remember, but in other
ways it is much worse. It is crazy how stupid basically every scene
with Jar Jar is. There's also barely a plot as the characters just
stumble from one activity to the next. It's very strange.

entry.title: Game: Shovel Knight (Steam, 2014) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Shovel Knight (Steam, 2014) (2)20151221
I finished the game today. The last few levels I kind of rushed
through. I managed to beat the boss rush on the first try,
although I did use a chalice. The very last boss also took two
tries. I don't think I will immediately play NG+ or Plague Knight
mode, perhaps I will put the back in the queue listed separately.
